topic: How to package WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to package WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Packaging WASM Targets Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a step-by-step guide on how to use FastAPI to package WebAssembly (WASM) targets for deployment in Python 3.12+ applications.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+.
Python 3.12 introduces support for WebAssembly (WASM) which allows running Python code in the browser and other environments without a Python interpreter.
This guide demonstrates how to use FastAPI to create a WASM-based API that can be deployed independently of any server-side Python runtime.
The process involves compiling Python code to WebAssembly using the PyO3 and wasm3 libraries, and integrating it with FastAPI.
The resulting WASM module can be served directly as a static file or by using third-party solutions like as serving via Nginx.

code_examples.code:
```sh
# Compile the Python code using Rust
$ rustup target add wasm32-unknown-unknown
$ cargo build --target wasm32-unknown-unknown --release

# Package the compiled WASM module and FastAPI application files
$ cp target/wasm32-unknown-unknown/release/fastapi_wasm.wasm .
$ cp fastapi_wasm.py app.py .
$ mkdir -p build
$ cd build
$ cmake ..
$ make
$ cd ..

version_notes: Python 3.12 is required for this tutorial.
Rust toolchain version 1.65 or later is needed to compile the WASM module.
FastAPI v0.74 or later is recommended for integrating with WASM.
caveats: WebAssembly support in Python may have limited compatibility with certain libraries and dependencies, which could require additional effort to work around.
The compiled WASM module can consume significant memory depending on the complexity of the Python code it contains.
It's essential to test the performance of your WASM-based API and optimize as needed for production use.
